section.title: xx.skew
section.para: The xx.skew file specifies local coordinate systems for nodes. The local coordinate system is specified using two Euler angles that rotate the local coordinate system to the global coordinate system.

The applied coordinate rotations apply to all boundary conditions associated with the nodes listed in the file. These are useful, for example, if it is desired to apply boundary conditions in a direction normal or tangential to a side of the mesh when the side does not align with the global coordinate directions. Similarly, skew conditions could be used when specifying slip on a fault that lies at an angle to the global coordinates.

figure.title: Format of xx.time files
figure.screen: # File containing local nodal coordinates. # # Comment lines begin with '#' # # First, specify units for rotations. # rotation_units = degree # # # Columns: # (1) Node number # (2) Euler angle for rotation in the x-y plane # (3) Euler angle for rotation in the x-z plane # 68 12.3 4.2 132 -12.3 -4.2 ...
